website_summaries.verdict: A well-written intermediate-level reference book that deals with all aspects of creating, hosting, and maintaining a web site.
pros: 5 sections take you from "Getting Started" to "Publishing and Site Maintenance."
Covers HTML5, CSS3, and other core web design topics
Well written and useful, particularly as a reference book
cons: Not really geared toward a beginning web designer
Some felt that it focuses too much on Adobe Dreamweaver

customer_reviews.title: More expensive than you need
customer_reviews.text: There are quite a few websites that will teach you the skill a whole lot cheaper than this book. Unless you can get it for next to nothing, stick to free or cheap websites and cheap references.

customer_reviews.title: Good book but too focused on Dreamweaver
customer_reviews.text: The book is a good tool for beginners, such as myself. However, it supports a very important portion of its explanations on Adobe Dreamweaver. For first time learners such as myself, who don't happen to own that Software, this becomes a nuisance, since you fail to receive the complete explanation or concept, and instead get the "it comes automatic in Dreamweaver" alternative.

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy

customer_reviews.author: Anthony Greene

customer_reviews.title: Ooh Dreamweaver
customer_reviews.text: It's important to note this is a web design book and not a web development book. It takes the WYSIWYG web editor (Dreamweaver) approach over manual coding for most the examples. Dreamweaver is probably an easier way to go about designing—though I would have preferred the book provide more coding instructions. I would recommend this book to someone that has Adobe CC and is trying to learn web design using Dreamweaver. It's a good book for what it is, but not an exhaustive resource.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good service, comprehensive information. I checked this out of the library but concluded that it would be worth ordering.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy D.

customer_reviews.title: A Great Book for Beginners to Web Design and HTML/CSS
customer_reviews.text: A great reference book for how to construct web pages or even websites as laid out in simple terms by Sue Jenkins. Jenkins does an excellent job at explaining a dry and difficult subject area for many readers who are looking to build their own web pages or websites. Topics covered include basic HTML, CSS, web folder hierarchy for web design, Javascript, and much more.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W
